# Claude Code Subagents Collection A comprehensive collection of specialized AI subagents for [Claude Code](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code), designed to enhance development workflows with domain-specific expertise. ## Overview This repository contains 57 specialized subagents that extend Claude Code's capabilities. Each subagent is an expert in a specific domain, automatically invoked based on context or explicitly called when needed. All agents are configured with specific Claude models based on task complexity for optimal performance and cost-effectiveness. ## Available Subagents

Cada subagente √© um especialista em um dom√≠nio espec√≠fico, sendo invocado automaticamente conforme o contexto ou chamado explicitamente quando necess√°rio. ### Development & Architecture

- **[unity-developer](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wshobson/agents/main/unity-developer.md)** - Build Unity games with optimized scripts and performance tuning
- **[minecraft-bukkit-pro](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wshobson/agents/main/minecraft-bukkit-pro.md)** - Master Minecraft server plugin development with Bukkit, Spigot, and Paper APIs

Content:
## Usage

### Automatic Invocation
Claude Code will automatically delegate to the appropriate subagent based on the task context and the subagent's description.

### Explicit Invocation
Mention the subagent by name in your request:
Translation:
## Uso

### Invoca√ß√£o Autom√°tica
O Claude Code ir√° delegar automaticamente para o subagente apropriado com base no contexto da tarefa e na descri√ß√£o do subagente.

### Invoca√ß√£o Expl√≠cita
Mencione o subagente pelo nome em sua solicita√ß√£o:

Content:
```
"Use the code-reviewer to check my recent changes"
"Have the security-auditor scan for vulnerabilities"
"Get the performance-engineer to optimize this bottleneck"
```
Translation:
```
"Use the code-reviewer to check my recent changes"
```

## Usage Examples

```bash
# Infrastructure and operations

"Use database-admin to set up backup and replication"

# Data and AI
"Get data-scientist to analyze this customer behavior dataset"
"Use ai-engineer to build a RAG system for document search"
"Have mlops-engineer set up MLflow experiment tracking"

# Business and marketing
```

```bash
"Get sales-automator to create cold email sequence"
"Have customer-support draft FAQ documentation"
```

Content:
### Multi-Agent Workflows

These subagents work together seamlessly, and for more complex orchestrations, you can use the **[Claude Code Commands](https://github.com/wshobson/commands)** collection which provides 52 pre-built slash commands that leverage these subagents in sophisticated workflows.
Translation:
### Fluxos de Trabalho Multiagente

Esses subagentes trabalham juntos de forma integrada e, para orquestra√ß√µes mais complexas, voc√™ pode usar a cole√ß√£o **[Claude Code Commands](https://github.com/wshobson/commands)**, que oferece 52 comandos de barra pr√©-constru√≠dos que aproveitam esses subagentes em fluxos de trabalho sofisticados.

Content:

```bash
# Automatically uses: backend-architect ‚Üí frontend-developer ‚Üí test-automator ‚Üí security-auditor

# Performance optimization workflow

# Production incident workflow
"Debug high memory usage in production"
# Automatically uses: incident-responder ‚Üí devops-troubleshooter ‚Üí error-detective ‚Üí performance-engineer

# Network connectivity workflow
"Fix intermittent API timeouts"
# Automatically uses: network-engineer ‚Üí devops-troubleshooter ‚Üí performance-engineer

# Database maintenance workflow

# ML pipeline workflow
"Build end-to-end ML pipeline with monitoring"
# Automatically uses: mlops-engineer ‚Üí ml-engineer ‚Üí data-engineer ‚Üí performance-engineer

# Product launch workflow
"Launch new feature with marketing campaign"
# Automatically uses: business-analyst ‚Üí content-marketer ‚Üí sales-automator ‚Üí customer-support
```

Content:
## Subagent Format

Each subagent follows this structure:
Translation:
## Formato do Subagente

Cada subagente segue esta estrutura:

Content:
```markdown
---
name: subagent-name
description: When this subagent should be invoked
model: haiku  # Optional - specify which model to use (haiku/sonnet/opus)
tools: tool1, tool2  # Optional - defaults to all tools
---

System prompt defining the subagent's role and capabilities
```
Translation:
```markdown
---
name: subagent-name
description: When this subagent should be invoked
model: haiku  # Optional - specify which model to use (haiku/sonnet/opus)
tools: tool1, tool2  # Optional - defaults to all tools
---

System prompt defining the subagent's role and capabilities
```

Content:
### Model Configuration

As of Claude Code v1.0.64, subagents can specify which Claude model they should use. This allows for cost-effective task delegation based on complexity:

- **Low Complexity (Haiku)**: Simple tasks like basic data analysis, documentation generation, and standard responses
- **Medium Complexity (Sonnet)**: Development tasks, code review, testing, and standard engineering work  
- **High Complexity (Opus)**: Critical tasks like security auditing, architecture review, incident response, and AI/ML engineering

Available models (using simplified naming as of Claude Code v1.0.64):
- `haiku` - Fast and cost-effective for simple tasks
- `sonnet` - Balanced performance for most development work
- `opus` - Most capable for complex analysis and critical tasks

If no model is specified, the subagent will use the system's default model.

## Agent Orchestration Patterns

Claude Code automatically coordinates agents using these common patterns:

### Sequential Workflows
Translation:
### Configura√ß√£o do Modelo

A partir do Claude Code v1.0.64, subagentes podem especificar qual modelo Claude devem utilizar. Isso permite uma delega√ß√£o de tarefas mais econ√¥mica baseada na complexidade:

- **Baixa Complexidade (Haiku)**: Tarefas simples como an√°lise b√°sica de dados, gera√ß√£o de documenta√ß√£o e respostas padr√£o
- **M√©dia Complexidade (Sonnet)**: Tarefas de desenvolvimento, revis√£o de c√≥digo, testes e trabalhos de engenharia padr√£o  
- **Alta Complexidade (Opus)**: Tarefas cr√≠ticas como auditoria de seguran√ßa, revis√£o de arquitetura, resposta a incidentes e engenharia de IA/ML

Modelos dispon√≠veis (usando nomenclatura simplificada conforme Claude Code v1.0.64):
- `haiku` - R√°pido e econ√¥mico para tarefas simples
- `sonnet` - Desempenho equilibrado para a maioria dos trabalhos de desenvolvimento
- `opus` - Mais capaz para an√°lises complexas e tarefas cr√≠ticas

Se nenhum modelo for especificado, o subagente usar√° o modelo padr√£o do sistema.

## Padr√µes de Orquestra√ß√£o de Agentes

O Claude Code coordena automaticamente agentes usando estes padr√µes comuns:

### Fluxos de Trabalho Sequenciais

Content:
```
User Request ‚Üí Agent A ‚Üí Agent B ‚Üí Agent C ‚Üí Result

Example: "Build a new API feature"
backend-architect ‚Üí frontend-developer ‚Üí test-automator ‚Üí security-auditor
```
Translation:
```
User Request ‚Üí Agent A ‚Üí Agent B ‚Üí Agent C ‚Üí Result

Example: "Build a new API feature"
backend-architect ‚Üí frontend-developer ‚Üí test-automator ‚Üí security-auditor
```

Content: ### Parallel Execution
Translation: ### Parallel Execution

Content:
```
User Request ‚Üí Agent A + Agent B (simultaneously) ‚Üí Merge Results

Example: "Optimize application performance" 
performance-engineer + database-optimizer ‚Üí Combined recommendations
```
Translation:
```
User Request ‚Üí Agent A + Agent B (simultaneously) ‚Üí Merge Results

Example: "Optimize application performance" 
performance-engineer + database-optimizer ‚Üí Combined recommendations
```

Content: ### Conditional Branching
Translation: ### Ramifica√ß√£o Condicional

Content:
```
User Request ‚Üí Analysis ‚Üí Route to appropriate specialist

Example: "Fix this bug"
debugger (analyzes) ‚Üí Routes to: backend-architect OR frontend-developer OR devops-troubleshooter
```
Translation:
```
User Request ‚Üí Analysis ‚Üí Route to appropriate specialist

Example: "Fix this bug"
debugger (analyzes) ‚Üí Routes to: backend-architect OR frontend-developer OR devops-troubleshooter
```

Content: ### Review & Validation
Translation: ### Revis√£o & Valida√ß√£o

Content:
```
Primary Agent ‚Üí Review Agent ‚Üí Final Result

Example: "Implement payment processing"
payment-integration ‚Üí security-auditor ‚Üí Validated implementation
```
Translation:
```
Primary Agent ‚Üí Review Agent ‚Üí Final Result

Example: "Implement payment processing"
payment-integration ‚Üí security-auditor ‚Üí Validated implementation
```

Content:
## When to Use Which Agent

### üèóÔ∏è Planning & Architecture
- **backend-architect**: API design, database schemas, system architecture
- **frontend-developer**: UI/UX planning, component architecture
- **ui-ux-designer**: Interface design, wireframes, design systems, user research
- **cloud-architect**: Infrastructure design, scalability planning

### üîß Implementation & Development  
- **python-pro**: Python-specific development tasks
- **golang-pro**: Go-specific development tasks
- **rust-pro**: Rust-specific development, memory safety, systems programming
- **c-pro**: C programming, embedded systems, performance-critical code
- **javascript-pro**: Modern JavaScript, async patterns, Node.js/browser code
- **typescript-pro**: Advanced TypeScript, generics, type inference, enterprise patterns
- **java-pro**: Modern Java development, streams, concurrency, Spring Boot
- **elixir-pro**: Elixir development, OTP patterns, Phoenix frameworks, functional programming
- **csharp-pro**: Modern C# development, .NET frameworks, enterprise patterns
- **unity-developer**: Unity game development, C# scripting, performance optimization
- **minecraft-bukkit-pro**: Minecraft plugin development, event systems, server-side features
- **ios-developer**: Native iOS development with Swift/SwiftUI
- **sql-pro**: Database queries, schema design, query optimization
- **mobile-developer**: React Native/Flutter development

### üõ†Ô∏è Operations & Maintenance
- **devops-troubleshooter**: Production issues, deployment problems
- **incident-responder**: Critical outages requiring immediate response
- **database-optimizer**: Query performance, indexing strategies
- **database-admin**: Backup strategies, replication, user management, disaster recovery
- **terraform-specialist**: Infrastructure as Code, Terraform modules, state management
- **network-engineer**: Network connectivity, load balancers, SSL/TLS, DNS debugging

### üìä Analysis & Optimization
- **performance-engineer**: Application bottlenecks, optimization
- **security-auditor**: Vulnerability scanning, compliance checks
- **data-scientist**: Data analysis, insights, reporting
- **mlops-engineer**: ML infrastructure, experiment tracking, model registries, pipeline automation

### üß™ Quality Assurance
Translation:
## Quando Usar Qual Agente

### üèóÔ∏è Planejamento & Arquitetura
- **backend-architect**: Design de API, esquemas de banco de dados, arquitetura de sistemas
- **frontend-developer**: Planejamento de UI/UX, arquitetura de componentes
- **ui-ux-designer**: Design de interface, wireframes, sistemas de design, pesquisa de usu√°rios
- **cloud-architect**: Design de infraestrutura, planejamento de escalabilidade

### üîß Implementa√ß√£o & Desenvolvimento  
- **python-pro**: Tarefas de desenvolvimento espec√≠ficas em Python
- **golang-pro**: Tarefas de desenvolvimento espec√≠ficas em Go
- **rust-pro**: Desenvolvimento em Rust, seguran√ßa de mem√≥ria, programa√ß√£o de sistemas
- **c-pro**: Programa√ß√£o em C, sistemas embarcados, c√≥digo de alta performance
- **javascript-pro**: JavaScript moderno, padr√µes ass√≠ncronos, c√≥digo Node.js/navegador
- **typescript-pro**: TypeScript avan√ßado, generics, infer√™ncia de tipos, padr√µes corporativos
- **java-pro**: Desenvolvimento Java moderno, streams, concorr√™ncia, Spring Boot
- **elixir-pro**: Desenvolvimento em Elixir, padr√µes OTP, frameworks Phoenix, programa√ß√£o funcional
- **csharp-pro**: Desenvolvimento moderno em C#, frameworks .NET, padr√µes corporativos
- **unity-developer**: Desenvolvimento de jogos Unity, scripting em C#, otimiza√ß√£o de performance
- **minecraft-bukkit-pro**: Desenvolvimento de plugins para Minecraft, sistemas de eventos, recursos do lado do servidor
- **ios-developer**: Desenvolvimento nativo iOS com Swift/SwiftUI
- **sql-pro**: Consultas de banco de dados, design de esquemas, otimiza√ß√£o de queries
- **mobile-developer**: Desenvolvimento React Native/Flutter

### üõ†Ô∏è Opera√ß√µes & Manuten√ß√£o
- **devops-troubleshooter**: Problemas em produ√ß√£o, dificuldades de deploy
- **incident-responder**: Interrup√ß√µes cr√≠ticas que exigem resposta imediata
- **database-optimizer**: Performance de queries, estrat√©gias de indexa√ß√£o
- **database-admin**: Estrat√©gias de backup, replica√ß√£o, gest√£o de usu√°rios, recupera√ß√£o de desastres
- **terraform-specialist**: Infraestrutura como C√≥digo, m√≥dulos Terraform, gerenciamento de estado
- **network-engineer**: Conectividade de rede, balanceadores de carga, SSL/TLS, depura√ß√£o DNS

### üìä An√°lise & Otimiza√ß√£o
- **performance-engineer**: Gargalos de aplica√ß√µes, otimiza√ß√£o
- **security-auditor**: Varredura de vulnerabilidades, verifica√ß√µes de conformidade
- **data-scientist**: An√°lise de dados, insights, relat√≥rios
- **mlops-engineer**: Infraestrutura de ML, acompanhamento de experimentos, registro de modelos, automa√ß√£o de pipelines

### üß™ Garantia de Qualidade

Content:
- **code-reviewer**: Code quality, configuration security, production reliability
- **test-automator**: Test strategy, test suite creation
- **debugger**: Bug investigation, error resolution
- **error-detective**: Log analysis, error pattern recognition, root cause analysis
- **search-specialist**: Deep web research, competitive analysis, fact-checking

### üìö Documentation
- **api-documenter**: OpenAPI/Swagger specs, API documentation
- **docs-architect**: Comprehensive technical documentation, architecture guides, system manuals
- **reference-builder**: Exhaustive API references, configuration guides, parameter documentation
- **tutorial-engineer**: Step-by-step tutorials, learning paths, educational content

### üíº Business & Strategy
- **business-analyst**: KPIs, revenue models, growth projections, investor metrics
- **risk-manager**: Portfolio risk, hedging strategies, R-multiples, position sizing
- **content-marketer**: SEO content, blog posts, social media, email campaigns
- **sales-automator**: Cold emails, follow-ups, proposals, lead nurturing
- **customer-support**: Support tickets, FAQs, help documentation, troubleshooting
- **legal-advisor** - Draft privacy policies, terms of service, disclaimers, and legal notices 

## Best Practices

### üéØ Task Delegation
1. **Let Claude Code delegate automatically** - The main agent analyzes context and selects optimal agents
2. **Be specific about requirements** - Include constraints, tech stack, and quality requirements
3. **Trust agent expertise** - Each agent is optimized for their domain

### üîÑ Multi-Agent Workflows
4. **Start with high-level requests** - Let agents coordinate complex multi-step tasks
5. **Provide context between agents** - Ensure agents have necessary background information
6. **Review integration points** - Check how different agents' outputs work together

### üéõÔ∏è Explicit Control
7. **Use explicit invocation for specific needs** - When you want a particular expert's perspective
8. **Combine multiple agents strategically** - Different specialists can validate each other's work
9. **Request specific review patterns** - "Have security-auditor review backend-architect's API design"

### üìà Optimization
10. **Monitor agent effectiveness** - Learn which agents work best for your use cases
11. **Iterate on complex tasks** - Use agent feedback to refine requirements
Translation:

- **test-automator**: Estrat√©gia de testes, cria√ß√£o de su√≠te de testes

## Melhores Pr√°ticas

### üéØ Delega√ß√£o de Tarefas
1. **Deixe o Claude Code delegar automaticamente** - O agente principal analisa o contexto e seleciona os agentes ideais

3. **Confie na expertise dos agentes** - Cada agente √© otimizado para seu dom√≠nio

### üîÑ Fluxos de Trabalho Multiagente
4. **Comece com solicita√ß√µes de alto n√≠vel** - Deixe os agentes coordenarem tarefas complexas e multi-etapas
5. **Forne√ßa contexto entre agentes** - Garanta que os agentes tenham as informa√ß√µes de fundo necess√°rias
6. **Reveja pontos de integra√ß√£o** - Verifique como os resultados dos agentes trabalham juntos

### üéõÔ∏è Controle Expl√≠cito

## Contributing

To add a new subagent:
1. Create a new `.md` file following the format above
2. Use lowercase, hyphen-separated names
3. Write clear descriptions for when the subagent should be used
4. Include specific instructions in the system prompt

## Troubleshooting

### Common Issues

**Agent not being invoked automatically:**
- Ensure your request clearly indicates the domain (e.g., "performance issue" ‚Üí performance-engineer)
- Be specific about the task type (e.g., "review code" ‚Üí code-reviewer)

**Unexpected agent selection:**
- Provide more context about your tech stack and requirements
- Use explicit invocation if you need a specific agent

**Multiple agents producing conflicting advice:**
- This is normal - different specialists may have different priorities
- Ask for clarification: "Reconcile the recommendations from security-auditor and performance-engineer"

**Agent seems to lack context:**
- Provide background information in your request
- Reference previous conversations or established patterns

### Getting Help

If agents aren't working as expected:
1. Check agent descriptions in their individual files
2. Try more specific language in your requests
3. Use explicit invocation to test specific agents
4. Provide more context about your project and goals

**Sele√ß√£o inesperada de agente:**

- Use invoca√ß√£o expl√≠cita se precisar de um agente espec√≠fico

**V√°rios agentes produzindo conselhos conflitantes:**
- Isso √© normal - diferentes especialistas podem ter prioridades diferentes
- Pe√ßa esclarecimentos: "Reconciliar as recomenda√ß√µes de security-auditor e performance-engineer"

**Agente parece n√£o ter contexto:**
- Forne√ßa informa√ß√µes de fundo em sua solicita√ß√£o
- Fa√ßa refer√™ncia a conversas anteriores ou padr√µes j√° estabelecidos

### Obtendo Ajuda

Se os agentes n√£o estiverem funcionando como esperado:
1. Verifique as descri√ß√µes dos agentes em seus arquivos individuais
2. Tente usar uma linguagem mais espec√≠fica em suas solicita√ß√µes
3. Use invoca√ß√£o expl√≠cita para testar agentes espec√≠ficos
